title: Icons/system windows show as capture targets for Window Capture on macOS

labels.name: Confirmed
labels.description: This bug report has been confirmed by project members

body:
<!-- READ THIS FIRST -->
<!-- The OBS Studio GitHub issue tracker is **ONLY** to be -->
<!-- used for reporting Bugs that have replication steps. -->

<!-- You can post Feature Requests here: https://ideas.obsproject.com/ -->
<!-- Get help for Support Issues here: https://obsproject.com/help -->

When using Window Capture on macOS, several junk items appear, clogging the window capture list. 
These appear to be simply icons when captured, and should not be shown in the window list to avoid
clutter and confusion with end users. Examples:

- [Google Chrome] Item-0
- [OBS] Item-0
- [OBS] (all main OBS windows/settings windows)
- [Window Server] Backstop Menubar
- [Window Server] Desktop
- [Window Server] Menubar
- [TextInputMenuAgent] Item-0
- [Spotlight] Item-0

## Platform
<!-- Please fill out the following information about your bug report. -->
<!-- If you are on Linux and installed using a package, please list the package type. -->
Operating system and version: macOS 10.15.5 Catalina
OBS Studio version: 25.0.8

## Expected Behavior
System windows should not be displayed in window capture.
We currently have a blacklist for these items on Windows OS,
and this should be expanded to include items on macOS.

## Current Behavior
Window capture lists system windows not designed for capture.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Open OBS
2. Add Window Capture
3. Check the list and observe several nonsense and Item-0 options in the list that are not actual windows.

## Additional information
N/A
